availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Tecumseh Milam (Franklin County, Kentucky merchant and solder)

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky merchant, soldier and railroad conductor. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Morgan Milam in 1854. Father of John Morgan Milam, Anna B. Milam, William Milam and Charles Milam. Employed as a merchant in Franklin County in 1860. Served in Company A of the 22nd Regiment of the Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as a private from January 10, 1862 to March 1, 1862. Employed as a railroad conductor in Oldham County, Kentucky in 1870.

ab.bibl:
Indiana Marriage Records, Clark County Marriages, Film #001415852, p554

Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, La Grange, p. 66A
